lv.lumii.layoutengine

Class LayoutConstraints.GridLayoutConstraints

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.lumii.layoutengine.LayoutConstraints
      • lv.lumii.layoutengine.LayoutConstraints.GridLayoutConstraints
  • Enclosing class:
    LayoutConstraints

    public static class LayoutConstraints.GridLayoutConstraints
extends LayoutConstraints
    These constraints implement the grid borders in the container. The grid is ensured in both global layout and diagram editing operations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class lv.lumii.layoutengine.LayoutConstraints

        LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType, LayoutConstraints.GridLayoutConstraints, LayoutConstraints.NoneLayoutConstraints

    • Method Detail

      • getColumn

        public java.lang.Integer getColumn(Element elem)
        Returns the column number of the given element, or null if none. Column numbers are 1-based.
        Parameters:
        elem - the element whose column to get.
        Returns:
        the column number of the given element, or null if none.

      • getRow

        public java.lang.Integer getRow(Element elem)
        Returns the row number of the given element, or null if none. Row numbers are 1-based.
        Parameters:
        elem - the element whose row number to get.
        Returns:
        the row number of the given element, or null if none.

      • setColumn

        public void setColumn(Element elem,
                      java.lang.Integer column)
        Sets the column of the element. The element should be one of the elements contained in the associated container. The action is carried out immediately or at the end of transaction of the diagram. Column numbers are 1-based.
        Parameters:
        elem - the element whose column to set
        column - the new column number of the element, can be null

      • setRow

        public void setRow(Element elem,
                   java.lang.Integer row)
        Sets the row of the element. The element should be one of the elements contained in the associated container. The action is carried out immediately or at the end of transaction of the diagram. Row numbers are 1-based.
        Parameters:
        elem - the element whose row to set
        row - the new row number of the element, can be null

      • setCell

        public void setCell(Element elem,
                    java.lang.Integer row,
                    java.lang.Integer column)
        Sets the cell of the element. The element should be one of the elements contained in the associated container. The action is carried out immediately or at the end of transaction of the diagram. Column and row numbers are 1-based.
        Parameters:
        elem - the element whose cell to set
        row - the new row of the element, can be null
        column - the new column of the element, can be null

      • addColumns

        public void addColumns(int count)
        Adds new columns to the right of the last column. The width of each new column will be equal to the default column width.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of the columns to add

      • addRows

        public void addRows(int count)
        Adds new rows to the bottom of the last row. The height of each new row will be equal to the default row height.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of the rows to add

      • setDefaultColumnWidth

        public void setDefaultColumnWidth(double width)
        Sets the new default column width used for new columns and when resetting column widths. The width must be positive.
        Parameters:
        width - the new default column width

      • setDefaultRowHeight

        public void setDefaultRowHeight(double height)
        Sets the new default row height used for new rows and when resetting row heights.
        Parameters:
        height - the new default row height

      • mergeColumns

        public void mergeColumns(int first,
                         int last)
        Merges consecutive grid columns from first to last, inclusive, into a single column by erasing intermediate grid constraint lines. The columns are renumbered automatically.
        Parameters:
        first - the index of the first column to merge
        last - the index of the last column to merge

      • mergeRows

        public void mergeRows(int first,
                      int last)
        Merges consecutive grid rows from first to last, inclusive, into a single row by erasing intermediate grid constraint lines. The rows are renumbered automatically.
        Parameters:
        first - the index of the first row to merge
        last - the index of the last row to merge

      • _setColumnRight

        public void _setColumnRight(int column,
                            double x)
        Sets the x coordinate of the right column border. This is an internal function and does not call normalization.
        Parameters:
        column - the column whose right border to change
        x - the new abscissa of the border

      • _setRowBottom

        public void _setRowBottom(int row,
                          double y)
        Sets the y coordinate of the bottom row border. This is an internal function and does not call normalization.
        Parameters:
        row - the row whose bottom border to change
        y - the new ordinate of the border

      • setColumnMinWidth

        public void setColumnMinWidth(int column,
                              double width)
        Sets the minimum width of the column. The action is carried out immediately or at the end of transaction of the diagram. The minimum width must be positive.
        Parameters:
        column - the column whose minimum width to set
        width - the new minimum width of the column

      • setRowMinHeight

        public void setRowMinHeight(int row,
                            double height)
        Sets the minimum height of the row. The action is carried out immediately or at the end of transaction of the diagram. The minimum height must be positive.
        Parameters:
        row - the row whose height to set
        height - the new minimum height of the row
